title: Trigger update via command line
content:
How can I trigger Firefox to check for updates via a command? We have FF installed on users' computers, but some users never use it. I would like to be able to trigger the FF updater to check for updates on a regular schedule. If FF is being used, then it would alert the user of the need to restart as usual. If not, then it will just update itself.

This would be for both Windows and Mac
creator: mikedowler

title: Install and configure Firefox 56 (with extensions) on Mac Big Sur
content:
Hello

I tried installing Firefox 56 on Mac Big Sur. But it is impossible to make settings.

1. Disable automatic update: about: config app.update.auto app.update.enabled I get an alert (blank error message) and I cannot exit Firefox.

2. Install an older version of the iMacros extension http://download.imacros.net/imacros_for_firefox-8.9.7-fx.xpi Cannot use this extension.

May be a write permission error somewhere ?

Thanks a lot
creator: paoma

title: Rolling Stone articles won't load from email link
content: I first noticed this problem when I would click on a link from an email from Rolling Stone magazine it goes to a blank page and the refresh icon is grayed out. I can use Copy Link Location from my email and paste it into Chrome or Edge web browsers and it works fine. I can copy from the blank screen address bar and paste into Chrome or Edge and it also works fine. Today I tried typing rollingstone.com into the address bar and got the same blank page with the refresh icon grayed out. I've not noticed this problem with any other website, just the Rolling Stone site. Any suggestions would be appreciated.

title: Title bar hides menu bar
content: Whenever I navigate to a new webpage or open a site in a new tab, the title bar for that page appears and obscures the menu bar (I had to look it up to define "menu bar" as the "file-edit-view etc. bar" and "title bar" as the bar that shows the title of the topmost tab or window in full). In order to get the title bar to go away, I have to flick the cursor to the top of the page and basically roll over it. But it doesn't stay gone. The title bar comes back with each page or tab I visit. The need to constantly tell it to go away is really making browsing troublesome. It started with the most recent update (86.0.1, 32-bit). I already have the title bar turned off in customization. I want to be able to hover over a tab to see a full title, but have that pesky title bar gone completely (which is what is supposed to happen when you uncheck it in customization). Any help greatly appreciated.
creator: satscout

title: Firefox in dark mode prints black bars instead of readable text.
content:

When I try to print, while it does not waste ink by printing the entire page black, where the text is the printed page only has black bars. An image of a print preview screen is attached. If there are settings to fix this there, I cannot see them because this does NOT use the dark mode and I can't see it.

Currently to print something, I take a screen shot and use another program to reverse the colors. I would like to not have to spend 30-40 min editing an image every time I want to print.

title: Graphic artifacts on videos and frequent tab crashes
content:
Hello,

I've been getting an error for some time now. Firefox tabs suddenly crash (usually media tabs with video, like Twitch or video conference sites) and I can't seem to find a solution. But most importantly, many videos or live streams show graphic artifacts. You can check it in the attached screenshot). I have tried many things to solve it, but none worked. This is what I tried:

  • Changing cables and monitors.
  • Disabling extensions and plugins.
  • Disabling hardware acceleration.
  • Installing Firefox from scratch.
  • Installing an old version.
  • Installing Nightly.
  • Removing the GPU. The issue persisted with a different video card and with integrated graphics. So the GPU is not the issue.
  • Trying using another OS. I thought my Windows install might have been corrupt, but it also happened in Ubuntu.
  • Trying other browsers. I tried Chrome (which resulted in the issue as well) and Edge (which surprisingly did fine, it's my only solution right now).

I would love to keep using Firefox but it's a pain to watch media like this. I don't know if the issue might be from the motherboard or another component. Between the crashes and this I can't use it normally.

I can try providing any details needed to solve the problem. Could you please help me? I don't know what else I can try.
creator: orphenkirisame

title: Find actually used proxy when configured to "Use System Proxy Settings"
content:
The configuration on page General - Connection Settings is set to Use System Proxy Settings. How can I find out I which proxy my Firefox browser is actually using?

Note: This very question has already been asked at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1208062. It has an answer which is marked as Chosen Solution although the question owner explicitly stated it doesn't answer the question, and indeed it doesn't because it just says to look at the configuration page which doesn't contain the information. That thread has been archived. Perhaps it should be deleted or at least the Chosen Solution mark removed.

title: Firefox suddenly not loading - have done all the trouble shooting item - now what?
content: Windows 10, Lenovo Yoga C940, Firefox working great. What I have done to try and solve -reboot several times, Restart in safe mode, refreshed, uninstall and re-installed, turn off firewall options as instructed, Scanned entire system for Malware (Norton 360), Cleared Cached and cookies, removed Patent Lock file. Before I remove Firefox totally and move to Chrome can anyone help? I have used Firefox for over 7 years - I don't what to move on. I looked at troubleshooting on firefox and it states Launch Process - Disabled due to Failure. Google answers to this point to things I have already done. webrender-software denied by env: not on allowlist
